availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Miller (Caldwell County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, attorney. Trigg County, Kentucky, native. Son of J.H. Miller. Married to Pernecia Wadlington Miller. Father of Rosa Miller, Josiah Miller, Hugh Miller, and Lula Miller. Student in Caldwell County in 1850. Attorney in Caldwell County in 1860. Employed Marina Bowers as a domestic servant in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Caldwell county in 1860. Delegate to the Kentucky Democratic State Convention in 1860. Died in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 279B.
